title: Dinner Party
description: Michael invites Jim and Pam and Andy and Angela to a couples-only dinner party, which makes Dwight very jealous. However, the only thing he's missing is a ringside seat to witness Michael and Jan's extremely dysfunctional home life.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: This is ridiculous.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Do you have any idea what time we'll get out of here?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nobody likes to work late, least of all me. [to Jim] Do you have plans tonight?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nope I don't, remember when you told us not to make plans 'cause we're working.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes I remember. Mmm, this is B.S. This is B.S. Why are we here? I am going to call corporate. Enough is enough, I'm - God, I'm so mad! [on phone] This is Michael Scott, Scranton, well we don't want to work. No we don't! It's not fair to these people. These people are my friends and I care about them! We're not going to do it! [hangs up] Everybody I just got off the horn with corporate and basically I told them where they could stick their little overtime assignment. Go enjoy your Friday.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thank you Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right, happy Friday. [to Jim] Well I think we dodged a bullet there.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I think you did.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I think we should celebrate. How about you, Pam, mi casa, a little dinner, dancing, drinks?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, I-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You said you didn't have plans. That's what you said.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Michael has asked Pam and me to dinner at least 9 times. And every time we've been able to get out of it. But I've got to give him credit, he got me. Because I'm starting to suspect that there was no assignment from corporate.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael, what time should I be arriving?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight, it's couples only. And besides, I only have six wine glasses, so it will be me and Jan, and Pam and Jim, and Angela and Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey-o!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Does it bother me that I wasn't invited to Michael's dinner party? [breaks down crying]

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hello.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: How are you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Come on in. Good to see you.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Chilly huh? So glad we finally got to do this with you guys. You wanna take their coats babe?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes I would. So, what have you been doing?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Let's see, since I saw you an hour ago?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I have been getting ready and then driving over here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well we have been doing pretty much the same thing.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Except driving.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We got you this. [gives a bottle of wine]

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Oh well Pam, thank you, this will be great to cook with.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well have a seat, or come on in, or, I don't know, make yourself to home. This is our casa.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It's really nice.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: So what do you guys think, should we do the tour first or the appetizers first?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Tour, let's do the tour first.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Do you have a preference babe? Upstairs first?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Totally your call babe.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Alright, well, let's go then, I say upstairs.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, you guys doing a little construction?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, just redoing the sliding glass door.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Yeah, so sorry about this God-awful carpet, we're still a work in progress here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, thats...

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: This is my office.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yep, never been used.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Not super exciting.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: And this is my workspace.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This is it, check that out, can you smell that? [the room is filled with candles that say "Serenity by Jan"]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Uh-huh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: As you can smell there's a lot of different odors going on in here.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So you have an office and a workspace?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I do, I cannot create in the same space I conduct business, I'm sure that you're the same with your doodles. [puts a candle to Jim's nose] Smell.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It's fire.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Uh-huh, Bonfire.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Bond.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Men love this one.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: James Bond Fire. I am Bond fire, James Bond Fire. Michael Scarn. [clicks tongue]

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: When I get frustrated, or irritated or... angry, I come up here and I just smell all my candles and it just -poof- goes away.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Just like that.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Just like that.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: So this is the master bedroom, and these walls used to like white, like an asylum. So I wanted it to be softer, So I had it painted in eggshell white.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Guess what, white and eggshell white are exactly the same color.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [puts away video camera facing the bed] Babe I thought you said you were going to tidy things up.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, I-

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Shame on you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What a cute bench.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thanks, that's my bed. Jan has some space issues, so I curl up on that puppy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Really? 'cause... seems pretty narrow... and short.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's actually a lot bigger than it seems. Look at this. [Lies down]

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: See, he fits perfectly.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I finally broke down and bought myself a plasma TV. Check it out. [reveals a tiny TV] I actually hung this on the wall myself. I want to show you something . A lot of people in the room, need more space? [moves TV back a couple inches] Voila, right in the wall.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sometimes I will just stand here and watch television for hours. I love it, I love this TV. Oh and I also built this table.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What is that chestnut?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I think that is either pine, or nordic cherry.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: It's pine.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Michael, I'm just terrible at all this stuff, so that's really cool.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, he tried to set up my TIVO for me but then I didn't have audio for a week.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: If you ever need any help, I am just a phone call away.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I bet you are.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, I saw - oh your Dundies. I'm surprised they're not out on the coffee table for everybody to see.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: It was between the neon beer sign and the Dundies so I said "Honey keep the trophies."

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh honey, I have the best trophy right here, aside from my Dundies.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [doorbell] Oh, excuse us just a second.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'll get it.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [Andy and Angela enter] So glad you're finally able to be here.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [Michael tries to hug Angela] No, no.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Tuna! What's up Tuna, we having tuna for dinner? [to Pam] I bet you're sick of tuna right? You probably have tuna every night. Tuna! [to Jan] These are for you. [hands flowers]

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Oh, how thoughtful.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Very nice.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Except for one flower, which is for... my flower.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Aw.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: What am I supposed to do with this?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: How 'bout we do the short tour and then I'll start dinner?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh I can help starting dinner if you need it.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Oh no no no, it's just the osso buco needs to braise for about three hours, everything else is done.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Three hours from now or three hours from earlier like 4:00?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: You know Pam, in Spain they often don't start eating until midnight.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: When in Rome.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Do you have a preference, upstairs first?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Whatever you say babe.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Follow me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How 'bout a toast. Shall I? Here's to good friends.

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.text: Cheers.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Kinda sorta an oaky afterbirth.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What was that?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: So music, should we turn some music?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah that sounds good.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Do you guys remember my old assistant Hunter? He is an excellent songwriter.

quotes.speaker: {Hunter}'s CD
quotes.text: You took me by the hand, Made me a man, That one night, You made everything all right, So raw, so right, All night, all right, Oh yeah, Oh yeah, So raw, so right, All night, all right, Oh yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what, Hunter was a terrible assistant, that is why Ryan fired him.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Well I think he's probably just about as reliable as Pam being that it usually takes you an afternoon to get back to me.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Sometimes I think she holds on to faxes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [To camera] I don't care what they say, I just want to eat. Which I realize is a lot to ask for... at a dinner party.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [playing charades] No it's a... hump. There's a hump.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Joe Camel!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Okay yes, first name of that animal and the second name is the state where Helena is the capital.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Montana.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Oh!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Joe Montana!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yes! Yes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Why didn't you just say 49ers quarterback?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right, [rhythim clapping] my my my my turn, my my my my turn, my my my my turn.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Babe can you just like really, woah, could you just simmer down?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What, no, I'm just making people laugh.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, I was watching Jim's face.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I was watching Jim.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And he was laughing.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: No smiling.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Look at him, he's laughing.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Michael and Jan seem to be playing their own separate game and it's called 'Let's see how uncomfortable we can make our guests' and they're both winning. So I'm going to make a run for it. [holds cellphone]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You'll never guess, I just got a message from my landlord apparently, my apartment flooded, something with a sprinkler. Pam, we should probably get going and see the damage.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well you don't need two of you to do that.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's true. Um... dinner sounded delicious. Pam I'll see you at home, thank you so much.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh Jim, I don't think you're going to abandon this party here all by itself.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I don't know because I everything I own is there.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You can buy new stuff but you can't buy a new party.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's true, that's a great point. Come on down here. Sit down on that couch and be amongst friends and we are not going to think about all your stuff being destroyed, all right.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Michael, you're up.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right here we go, this is going to be fun, ready. All right first name is Tom-

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: No no no, no names, no names,  no rhyming, no soundalikes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right, Okay, okay, you're getting inside my head. First name is blank and he goes on a cruise, he goes on a Caribbean CRUISE.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I don't know.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Katie Holmes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, Baah! But he's married to her!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, Dawson's Creek.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No! It has to be a real person Jim, come on. Okay, no no, I'm gonna pass, I'm gonna pass. Okay, rhymes with Parnold Schporzenegger.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: No rhyming!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Not really a rhyme.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Another clue, another clue.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, he is the governor of California, he is the Terminator.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Those aren't helpful.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Tom Cruise!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Time!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: God, does anybody read the paper?!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [Michael offers his coat to Pam, who is shivering] Oh, thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You're welcome.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [eyes Pam] I'm so, so sorry for the temperature in here.  The um, sliding glass door shattered. It's actually a really cute story. Do you wanna tell it babe or should I tell it?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't like that story babe.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Come on, it's a cute story, Michael ran through the sliding glass doors because he thought he heard the ice cream truck!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Stop, stop it! I mean, I like ice cream. Okay? Sue me. Oh, no, don't. I shouldn't say that jokingly because she will sue me. She loves to sue, loves lawsuits. You know honey, that door was extremely clean and it looked invisible.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: You are so right, you're so right because before I lived here, the glass was always covered in smudges, and then I moved in and I cleaned it so I guess that makes me the Devil.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ha ha, you are! She is! She is the devil! I'm in hell! Aaahhh I'm burning, help me!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You shouldn't joke about that.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Is there more wine in the kitchen?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I will get it, I will get it, what kind of hostess would I be if I didn't get. It's okay, I don't mind. In fact you know what, girl's trip, Angela come on. Girl's trip.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [checking the oven] Uh, not even close.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: So you keep a very tidy house.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: You should see our bathroom after Michael takes a bath, whew. But I don't have to tell you Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, yeah. What?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Oh well don't tell me that he's really changed since you guys dated.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, are you joking?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Well, Michael told me a little bit about it, but I see the way you look at him.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I have never, ever dated, or wanted to do anything resembling dating Michael, ever. Not ever, not now, not then, not now, not ever, ever.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I've noticed how you look at him at the office.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Mmhmm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [in the garage] So I spend most of my time right here. Have a hand [the chairs are shaped like hands]. So Jim I noticed you checking out Jan's candles.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh no she just put it in front of my face.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, did you know that candles are the number one fastest-growing product in the scent aroma market? $2 billion dollar a year industry. And for only $10,000, you could become a co-owner of "Serenity by Jan" What do you think about that?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Thought about it, I'm in.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm sorry, are you really trying to get us to invest in Jan's company?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm sorry. [doorbell rings] What now?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Coming! [Dwight and a woman are at the door holding wine glasses and a cooler]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hello.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: What are you doing here?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: We came here to eat dinner and to party, this is a dinner party right?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [whispering] Awesome.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: What is he doing here?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yes, What are you doing here?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight is my friend.

quotes.speaker: Woman
quotes.text: We weren't invited?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You said that I could not invite Dwight because he was not part of a couple, and because we didn't have enough wine glasses. Dwight brought glasses and a person.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Fine, whatever you want, just like always, whatever you want.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Whatever I want? It's never whatever I want. When I wanted to see Stomp, and you wanted to see Wicked, what did we see?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: We saw Wicked.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: When I said that I wanted to have kids, and you said, you wanted me to have a vasectomy, what did I do? And then when you said that you might want to have kids and I wasn't so sure, Who had the vasectomy reversed? And then when you said you defintely didn't want to have kids, who had it reversed back? Snip snap! Snip snap! Snip snap! I did. You have no idea the physical toll, that three vasectomies have on a person. And I bought this condo to fill with children.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I am so sorry that I don't want to bring kids into this screwed-up world, okay?  But look if you want to have kids, then fine you win. Let's have a [bleep]ing kid.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do you mean it? You want to have a kid? [Jan walks away]

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I hate my life.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So can we come in?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hmmm... Mmm... great turkey leg.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [crying] I'm just gonna check on dinner. [Jan gets up from the table]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Angela, would you like some of my beet salad?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I hate beet salad.

quotes.speaker: Woman
quotes.text: It's actually really good.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey hey hey hey. [to Angela] I know you love beet salad. I've seen you eat it many times.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: The thought of popping one of your beets into my mouth makes me want to vomit.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [leans across to Pam whispering] Pam... I hope she didn't do anything to the food.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [whispers] Like... like what?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I can't prove it but I think she might be trying to poison me. [Jan serves the food] Hey, looks great babe.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah it does.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I know Jan didn't poison the food. I know that. But if she was going to poison the food of someone at that table wouldn't it be me? Michael's former lover?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [Michael dips his steak into his wine] Can you not do that? It's disgusting.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know I have soft teeth, how can you say that?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Oops.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Excuse me for a second. [gets up from the table]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [to babysitter] So... how do you guys know each other?

quotes.speaker: Woman
quotes.text: I was his babysitter.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: And now you guys are dating?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Purely carnal and that's all you need to know.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Would you write down your e-mail because I have just so many questions...

quotes.speaker: Woman
quotes.text: E-mail?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nevermind.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok... alright... here we go. [takes down huge painting behind his seat and puts up a neon beer sign] There. [plugs it in] Oooookay.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's nice.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Everybody enjoying their meal?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Hey babe?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: How about we take the beer sign down until our guests leave and then we can discuss it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. No. I'm gonna leave it up. I think it ties the whole room together.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Ok. [gets up and goes over to the stereo and turns on Hunter's CD really loud]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [to the guests] Jan thinks Hunter is very talented. You know what? I don't think he's that good.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: At least he's an artist.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: BFD. I'm a screenwriter.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [shouting] AND I'M A CANDLEMAKER BUT YOU DON'T HEAR ME BRAGGING ABOUT IT!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: NO ALL YOU DO IS YOU GET ME TO TRY TO WORK ON MY RICH FRIENDS!

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: FOR AN INVESTMENT OPPORTUNITY!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: MAN! I WOULD LOVE TO BURN YOUR CANDLES!

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: YOU BURN IT. YOU BUY IT!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OH GOOD. I'LL BE YOUR FIRST CUSTOMER!

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: AND YOU'RE HARDLY MY FIRST!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [yells] THAT'S WHAT SHE SAID! [Jan gets an evil look on her face and picks up Michael's dundie and throws it into his plasma screen tv] THAT IS A 200 DOLLAR PLASMA SCREEN TV YOU JUST KILLED! Good luck paying me back on your zero dollars a year salary plus benefits, babe! [Jan goes upstairs crying.]

quotes.speaker: Woman
quotes.text: I'm gonna get going.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Fine. Get outta here.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It's getting late.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what guys, she'll be out of the bathroom soon.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [Jim and Pam head out the door and there are policemen at the door] Of course

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Get out of my way, I'll take care of this. OK.[to police] Uhhh what seems to be the problem officers?

quotes.speaker: Officer #1
quotes.text: Not now Dwight, We got a call about a disturbance?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nope. Nope. Nothing disturbing here. Just a couple of friends having an awesome dinner party.

quotes.speaker: Officer #2
quotes.text: The neighbors said they heard some shouting.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh... yes. There was some screaming but... um... my girlfriend... threw a dundie at my TV. Plasma.

quotes.speaker: Officer #1
quotes.text: You wanna press charges?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Would she get into trouble?

quotes.speaker: Officer
quotes.text: Yes.  She'd be charged.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I will take the fall. I did it.

quotes.speaker: Officer #2
quotes.text: You know you don't have to press charges, you could just try to be more quiet.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [running out the door)] Michael! [pleading] Michael. What are you doing to him?

quotes.speaker: Officer #1
quotes.text: Sir, do you have any other place you can stay? Maybe with one of your friends here?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [puts his hand on the Officer's shoulder] Michael can come home with me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jim? Pam?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh... my apartment's on fire

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [whispers] Flooded.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Flooded.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You people. [to Michael] Come on. You're sleeping with me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm gonna take you home Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nope.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Alright. [leads Michael away]

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Bye Babe!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [Pam and Jim are sitting in Jim's car in front of Detroit Coney Island Chili Dogs] This is the best burger I've ever had, babe.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know, babe, I should have told you but... I did something bad.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hmm?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [holds up Hunter's CD] I stole this. [Pam laughs] For you babe.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [Hunter's voice starts singing, Pam joins in] One night...

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Cut to Michael holding his head out of Dwight's car]

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Cut to Andy and Angela in Andy's car eating Ice cream. Andy tries to steal a bite of Angela's. She rolls down the window and smashes it against his car]

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Jan is watching Michael's cracked plasma screen TV and tries to fix his Dundie.]

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Michael and Dwight slow at a red light and see the woman at the bus stop, she waves to Dwight, who passes her by.]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: My ideals at a party? Easy. Jim. Pam. Ryan. The Mayor. Barack Obama. Shiloh Jolie-Pitt. Because at the end of the night, Brad or Angelina would have to come and pick him up and I would get to meet them. Shia La Beef because of Disturbia. Umm, all of the children of the world. Val Kilmer. But he probably wouldn't come, too famous. Obviously George Clooney. Umm... And Jan definitely, if there was room.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'll tell you about my ideal dinner party. John Wilkes Booth. Lee Harvey Oswald. Osama Bin Laden. John Wayne Gacy. Jeffrey Lionel Dahmer. "Oh hey guys, welcome to my home. Oh, here comes the waiter with the soup, hope you guys are hungry." Meanwhile, the waiter suddenly nods at me. [Dwight nods] But I don't acknowledge him. But I know he's an assassin because I trained him. Boom. Two minutes later, five dead psychopaths at my dining room table. All that's left to do is dispose of the bodies and collect the reward. Ugh, it's almost too easy.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: A little amuse-bouche, anyone?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [to Jim, quietly] Food!

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Okay, trivia!  Does anyone know what that means?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I believe it means mouth pleaser.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Oh!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: It's French.  I studied some French during my semester at sea.  Or, shall I say a semester at la mer, which is French for 'sea.'

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Andy, was that coordinated by the Cornell Study Abroad Office?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Mm-hmm, mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: The reason I ask is that Andy went to Cornell.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [Michael comes out of the powder room to rejoin the group] Ahh, did you wash your hands, babe?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, I did, for you, princess.  Even though I only went number one. [quietly to Jim] I didn't really wash my hands.  Ohhh, what have we here?  This looks delicious. [picks up amuse-bouche tray]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [quietly] Not with your hands.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [touching and moving each amuse-bouche] They need to be presented... royally... anyone?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Mmm. [takes one and eats it]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good stuff.  All right.   Let's get down to some wine drinking.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, my God, [eating a bar in the hallway] I thought I was gonna pass out.  [Jim takes it from her and takes a bite]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: We should probably get back.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mmm-mm.  I'm probably just gonna stay here for a while, say I got lost.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [coming up suddenly]  Are you eating?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It was just a little...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I didn't have anything, Jan.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Really, Pam.  This is a dinner party. [walks away. Pam looks at Jim accusingly]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm sorry.  She scares me. [walks away, Pam keeps eating]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael's dinner party is for couples only, which is why I wasn't initially invited.  But that was then.  I very recently entered into a serious, monogamous relationship.  [looking around] If that idiot ever gets here.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: So, this girl that I basically grew up with becomes Miss West Virginia, and then suddenly, all the boys start paying attention to me.  And it was funny because, you know, I never even considered myself beautiful until people started pointing it out to me.  You know, "Jan, wow, you are so much more beautiful than Miss West Virginia."  [laughs]  Ah, so that is why I uh... wait, Pam, what was your, what was your question?"

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Where did you grow up?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's been a rough couple of weeks.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Well, I just got into a little trouble with the neighbors.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Little trouble.  Yes.  Well, Jan fell asleep during her neighborhood watch shift.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Wow, you did neighborhood watch?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I did, and I had a very late shift and I had a little bit of wine and I fell asleep.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So she's passed out, and some kids spray-paint a swear word on the neighbors' dog...

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And the neighbors blamed Jan.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Yeah.  But, you know, it was my fault.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's like, you know, the dog shouldn't have been outside in the first place.  Anyway, it's a tragedy, really, because the paint is not gonna come off the dog until it sheds...

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So...

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: It was me!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What's that?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I spray-painted that dog.  It was sleek, and shiny, and perfect little haircut, it was parading around like it was God's gift to this God-forsaken town [laughs] and I just couldn't take it anymore, so I went over there and I held down my knee and I just spray-painted it until I was good and done. [claps]  It bit me on the arm, [reaches out and taps Jim] I didn't even feel it.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: What are you doing to him?  What... [sees neighbors' dog] is this about that stupid, ugly mutt?

quotes.speaker: Neighbor
quotes.text: She's a Weimaraner, you bitch!

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Please, please. Don't hurt him, okay?
